name: Salmon and Rice Balls
author: Noeller67
summary: This is something my mom used to make when I was growing up.  It's easy, inexpensive and filling!  I always make sure my canned salmon is wild caught for a healthier fish.  I also like to leave the bones in for the calcium - just crush them up between your fingers (they are really soft) as you come across them when you are mixing everything with your hands.  This is a nice recipe to have children help out with and they love to get their hands messy and be able to eat what they made for dinner.
ingredients: 2 (14.75 ounce) cans salmon, drained and flaked
1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of mushroom soup
directions: Bring the rice and 1/2 cup water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat
Reduce heat to medium-low, and cover; simmer until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes
Fluff with fork, and allow to cool
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spray an 11 x 9 baking pan with cooking spray
Remove the skin from the salmon (and bones if you prefer)
Combine salmon, optional carrots, onions, eggs, cooled rice, and salt and pepper in a large bowl
Form into 8 (tennis ball sized) balls, using about 3/4 cup salmon mixture per portion
Arrange balls in the prepared pan, allowing room for them to expand
Mix the soup and 1/2 cup water together in a small bowl; pour over the salmon balls
Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour
Allow salmon balls to rest for a few minutes before serving
